boardAPI

Class BattleshipBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • boardAPI.BattleshipBoard

  • public class BattleshipBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    Describes an instance of an n*n grid square board on which one can play a game of Battleship.

    Contains methods which can be used to place several instances of class Ship at various non-overlapping positions and orientations on the board, as well as fire shots at various locations, and retrieve the current status of the board and its ships.

    Since:
    2015-08-30
    Version:
    2.1
    Author:
    Jason Carlson (jccarlson @ miners.utep.edu)

    • Constructor Detail

      • BattleshipBoard

        public BattleshipBoard(int n,
                       int numShips)
        Constructor for BattleshipBoard.
        Parameters:
        n - The size of both dimensions of the board. All boards must be square.
        numShips - The number of ships which will be in the fleet.

    • Method Detail

      • addShip

        public boolean addShip(Ship newShip)
        Adds a new Ship to the fleet. If successful, sends a shipMoved(e) message to all listeners.

        Only available when locked == false.

        Parameters:
        newShip - Ship object to add to the fleet.
        Returns:
        true if added successfully, false otherwise.

      • addShip

        public boolean addShip(java.lang.String name,
                       int size,
                       int row,
                       int column,
                       boolean isVertical)
        Adds a new Ship to the fleet based on parameters.

        To add a Ship object which has already been defined, see addShip(Ship).

        Only available when locked == false.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new ship.
        size - The size of the new ship.
        row - The row of the top left corner of the new ship.
        column - The column of the top left corner of the new ship.
        isVertical - true if the ship is oriented vertically, false if horizontal.
        Returns:
        true if ship is successfully added, false otherwise.

      • removeShip

        public Ship removeShip(java.lang.String name)
        Removes a ship based on the case-insensitive name given.

        Only available when locked == false.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the ship to be removed (case insensitive).
        Returns:
        Ship object which was removed (null if not found or locked).

      • moveShip

        public boolean moveShip(java.lang.String name,
                        int row,
                        int column,
                        boolean isVertical)
        Moves a ship given by a case insensitive name to the location given by (row,column) with the given orientation, if possible, or does nothing.

        If successful, sends a shipMoved(e) message to all listeners.

        Only available when locked == false.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the ship to move (case insensitive).
        row - The row containing the new location of the upper left corner of the ship.
        column - The column containing the new location of the upper left corner of the ship.
        isVertical - true if the ship is oriented vertically, false if horizontal.
        Returns:
        true if moved successfully, false otherwise.

      • lockBoard

        public boolean lockBoard()
        Locks the board, preventing adding, moving, or removing ships. Enables shots to be fired.

        Only possible if numShips is equal to the size of fleet.

        Returns:
        true if successfully locked, false otherwise.

      • checkStatus

        public char checkStatus(int row,
                        int column)
        Checks the current status of the board at (row,column).

        Can be used regardless of whether the board is locked or not.

        Parameters:
        row - The row of the space to check.
        column - The column of the space to check.
        Returns:
        ' ' if no shot has been fired, 'H' if a hit was recorded, or 'M' if a miss was recorded.

      • fireShot

        public boolean fireShot(int row,
                        int column)
        Fires a shot, if valid, at (row, column), and updates the shot counter.

        Valid shots are those within the boundaries of the board, where a shot hasn't been fired previously.

        To check if the shot hit or missed, use checkStatus(int, int).

        Sends shotFired() and possibly gameOver() messages to listeners

        Parameters:
        row - The row of the space to shoot at.
        column - The column of the space to shoot at.
        Returns:
        true if a valid shot was fired, false otherwise.

      • getShipNames

        public java.lang.String[] getShipNames()
        Gets the names of all the ships on the board.
        Returns:
        an array of Strings containing the names of all the ships on the board.

      • getShipSunkStatus

        public boolean[] getShipSunkStatus()
        Gets an array showing whether each ship in the fleet is sunk or not.
        Returns:
        an array of booleans which are true if that ship is sunk, false otherwise.

      • getNumShots

        public int getNumShots()
        returns the number of (valid) shots fired at the board.
        Returns:
        the number of (valid) shots fired at the board.
        See Also:
        fireShot(int, int)

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        returns the square dimension of the board.
        Returns:
        n - the size of the board in units.

      • gameLost

        public boolean gameLost()
        Determines if this board has lost the game (all ships are sunk).
        Returns:
        true if all ships are sunk, false otherwise.

      • addBattleshipListener

        public void addBattleshipListener(BattleshipListener l)
        Adds a new listener.
        Parameters:
        l - a new BattleshipListener

      • removeBattleshipListener

        public void removeBattleshipListener(BattleshipListener l)
        Removes a listener.
        Parameters:
        l - a BattleshipListener that has been previously added.

      • sendShotFiredMessage

        public void sendShotFiredMessage(BattleshipEvent e)
        Sends a shotFired(e) message to all listeners.
        Parameters:
        e - A BattleshipEvent describing what happened when the shot was fired

      • sendGameOverMessage

        public void sendGameOverMessage(BattleshipEvent e)
        Sends a gameOver(e) message to all listeners.
        Parameters:
        e - A BattleshipEvent containing the gameOver status.

      • sendShipMovedMessage

        public void sendShipMovedMessage(BattleshipEvent e)
        Sends a shipMoved(e) message to all listeners.
        Parameters:
        e - A BattleshipEvent describing the ship that moved.
